flow-definition.description:
Manually run a portion of federation-master-manual-trigger or nightly/federation-clean-nightly-trigger

NOTE: if you run test-nightly, your coverage data will be included in coverage.internal.sifive.com

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: CONFIG_SET
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
config-sets
EX:
  • ALL
  • coreip_bullet
  • coreip_caboose
  • coreip_fcd
  • coreip_rocket
All Are Defined here
Also, pseudo-config-sets for FPGAs:
  • jenkins_fpga_arty
  • jenkins_fpga_arty_100t
  • jenkins_fpga_vc707

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: SUITE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
NOTE: suite also includes shorter suites (e.g. test-long will also run test-short)

Mapping of suite to Jenkins jobs:
  • federation-pull-request:
    • test-short
  • federation-master:
    • test-short
    • test-long
  • federation-test-long-manual-trigger:
    • test-short
    • test-long
  • torture/master:
    • test-torture
  • nightly/federation-clean-nightly-trigger:
    • test-short
    • test-long
    • test-nightly
    • test-torture

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GIT_COMMIT
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This can be your branch name or a hash pushed to github

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: RUNSUITE_NUM_THREADS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
Select the number of threads for run-suite, which is basically the number of configs to run at a time.
Based on this Number a Jenkins Agent Will be Selected-
  • Default Standard Agent
  • <= 4 Small Agent
  • > 8 BIG Agent

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SITEST_JOBS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The number of jobs from each sitest instance to run, basically number of simulation jobs to run for a given config

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: SLURM_PARTITION
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Which SLURM reasources should be used, Standard ~= Sigma Machines, Cloud ~= Theta Machines. When two partitions are specified it will use the first and if it fills up then overflow to second.

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: SITEST_DELETE_ON_PASS
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: If selected then passing simulation directory will be removed once simulation finishes.

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: NO_VERILOG_DIFF
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: So A LONG time back there was a bug when verilog was generated for the same seed it was different, so the with this disabled it will generate verilog twice and DIFF to ensure they are they are the same, otherwise with this enabled the double generation will be SKIPPED
